title: Who's Friends With Whom In The Middle East?
teaser: Discerning friends from enemies can be challenging when it comes to the complicated relationships in the Middle East.
contentencoded:
The U.S. considers Iran an adversary but recently Iran supported the effort to retake the Iraqi city of Tikrit from ISIS. That’s just one of the complicated relationships playing out across the Middle East, where discerning friends from enemies can be challenging. Here & Now security analyst Jim Walsh discusses this with host Jeremy Hobson.

Guest

  • Jim Walsh, Here & Now security analyst and an expert in international security at MITâ€™s Security Studies Program. He tweets @DrJimWalshMIT.
